thread.title: Al Sharpton threatens to picket Madison Square Garden over Charles Oakley's ban
thread.title_full: Al Sharpton threatens to picket Madison Square Garden over Charles Oakley's ban

author: Dan Sostek (daniel.sostek@performgroup.com)
title: Al Sharpton threatens to picket Madison Square Garden over Charles Oakley's ban
text:
February 13, 2017 4:51pm   4:51pm EST Civil rights leader Al Sharpton released a statement Monday demanding that Knicks owner James Dolan lift Charles Oakley's MSG ban. (Getty Images) 
Updated at 4:51 p.m. ET 
Updated at 4:51 p.m. ET 
After superstars such as LeBron James, Dwyane Wade and Chris Paul spoke up for him, Charles Oakley has another prominent figure in his corner for his battle with Knicks owner James Dolan. 
Civil rights leader Al Sharpton released a statement Monday in which he demanded that Dolan lift the ban he placed on Oakley after the f ormer Knicks star's arrest at the arena Wednesday. 
MORE: Knicks owner James Dolan sinks to new low in Charles Oakley battle 
Sharpton stated that if this demand is not met, he will help organize a protest in support of Oakley. 
"Rev. Sharpton is calling upon Mr. Dolan to lift the ban and reinstate Mr. Oakley’s privileges," the statement read. "In the event that the ban is not lifted, NAN’s Northeast Regional Director Kirsten John Foy is mobilizing people to picket Madison Square Garden in solidarity." 
The NAN is the National Action Network, a civil rights group founded by Sharpton. The Knicks' next home game is not until Feb. 25, when they take on the 76ers. Watch This
